elements.title: Funeral of a Mummy on the Nile (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the whereabouts of the painting Funeral of a Mummy on the Nile (pictured) were unknown for more than 100 years?

elements.title: had more Jews than Ossetians (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the capital of South Ossetia once had more Jews than Ossetians?

elements.title: Physica (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Lois N. Magner, Hildegard of Bingen's Physica is "probably the first book by a female author to discuss the elements and the therapeutic virtues of plants, animals, and metals"?

elements.title: Cliff Christl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cliff Christl, who became the Green Bay Packers team historian in 2014, estimated that he had recorded more than 250 oral histories with past players and coaches since the 1990s?

elements.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1992 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at the Eurovision Song Contest 1992, Johnny Logan became the first person to win the contest three times as either a performer or a songwriter?

elements.title: developed by Supermassive Games (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the positive reception for Until Dawn, developed by Supermassive Games, caught Sony by surprise and led to two spin-off games?

elements.title: ten-season streak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Seattle Storm had a ten-season streak of playoff appearances?

elements.title: Sirius Remembered (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stan Brakhage's film Sirius Remembered shows the decomposition of the corpse of his family's dog?

elements.title: Shmap'n Shmazz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tim Kinsella made most of the lyrics for Cap'n Jazz's only album, Shmap'n Shmazz, during his first experience with psilocybin mushrooms?
